Behavioral Rules

  • Site-wide rules always apply here.
  • If you have a question for me, you can always PM me. If you need to talk to me in thread, please bold your question so I can locate it better.
  • Play nice. If you absolutely have to use insults, target the playstyle, not the player.
  • Do not use provable randomization in this game. Saying that you rolled a dice is fine, using dice tag is not.
  • If you break any of these rules, I will punish you at my will. This can range from a simple warning to a modkill/force-replace.
  • If I feel like it, I always have a right to add/modify the rules. If I do, I will fully explain the reason behind such action.
  • Remember that at its core, Mafia is a game. Play to win, but have fun too!

Technical Rules

  • You control your vote through the bold or VOTE: Marquis-and-UNVOTE: Marquis tags. An unvote is not required to change your vote. Also, if it looks like a vote, I will count it. No tricking me!
Code: Select all
[b]bold[/b] or [vote]Marquis[/vote]-and-[unvote]Marquis[/unvote] tags
  • For insurance that your vote/unvote will be seen, please put it on its own line. Though I use Ctrl+F, I will not be held responsible if a vote hidden within other text goes unseen.
  • Lynch happens when half of the players + 1 vote the same person. Once lynch happens, the lynchee and the living players may talk in "Twilight" until I arrive and post the flip.
  • If the deadline is over before majority hits, the day will end with No Lynch.
  • If you do not submit a night action, it will count as No Action.
  • If you are lynched or killed, you may post one information-less "bah" post during the following Day phase.
  • Deadline for each day is 14 real days, and deadline for each night is 2 real days.
  • If I have to extend the deadline, I will. If I do, I will post it in the thread.
  • 48 real hours without a post means I will prod you. I will start looking for a replacement if you do not pick up the prod within 24 hours or if it is your 3rd prod.
  • If you will be on Vacation/Limited Access, please tell me beforehand; either post it in the thread, or PM it to me.

    • Game-Specific Rules

    • I will post only in Comic Sans from now until game end.
    • This may or may not be evidence of masochism.
    • Additional flavor may consist of, but is not limited to, the following: music videos, k-pop music videos, pictures drawn by yours truly, screenshots of things I like, links to my The Onion/Clickhole article of the day, etc. The "flavor" is unrelated to the game.

    • This game has been approved for both normalcy and balance.
    • The role Town Vanilla exists in this game. The universal Town Vanilla Role PM as well as the Role PM format for any Town power roles, modified or not, are given below:


    Hello, XXXX, and thanks for joining us in Mini 0000 — The Mod is Using Comic Sans!

    You are a Town Vanilla!

    You, like all other players, may post and use your vote during the Day. The following apply specifically to your role:

    Town - You win when all threats to the Town are eliminated.
    Vanilla - You have no special abilities.

    The game thread is here.

    Please reply confirming your role and alignment so the game can begin!


    Hello, XXXX, and thanks for joining us in Mini 0000 — The Mod is Using Comic Sans!

    You are a Town Modified Power Role!

    You, like all other players, may post and use your vote during the Day. The following apply specifically to your role:

    Town - You win when all threats to the Town are eliminated.
    Modifier - The following ability of yours is subject to this role modifier: Role (This line only appears if the role has a modifier.)
    Role - Your role has the power detailed here available to it.

    The game thread is here.

    Please reply confirming your role and alignment so the game can begin!

All Role PMs are out!

VOTE: emogirl

Hello, everybody! As you may know, I prefer to open the game up with questions for people rather than an arbitrary vote. So, if you would, can you answer these two questions for me?

1. Do you like being scum in games?
2. How good are you at lying?
(Additionally, if this is one of your first games here on the site, welcome, and I'd like to know that as well.)

If you think my questions are stupid or unhelpful, please just answer them and I can move on to other things. If you think the questions are actually harmful or you think I am using them in lieu of participating, please state so. Thanks!
If we think they are stupid and unhelpful, why would we still answer them?

In post 17, Beck wrote:If we think they are stupid and unhelpful, why would we still answer them?

Because you might be wrong about that, and they might be useful. If you think they won't help or hurt, answering them is the easiest way to not turn the first several days into some drama-magnet about whether or not you should answer questions you don't think are useful. The amount of effort required to answer them is trivial to you, and of some minor utility to me (and maybe others) in scumhunting. It's win-win.

This is entirely separate from if you think they are harmful to answer. If you think answering them will help scum more than helping town, then it's best to air that out now. (I don't think answering them is harmful, but I'm willing to entertain disagreement on that.)

do you normally start games like this? if yes can you show me a game where you used those questions to find scum?

personally these questions looks to be a way to distract people from scum hunting.

In post 19, Beck wrote:do you normally start games like this? if yes can you show me a game where you used those questions to find scum?

personally these questions looks to be a way to distract people from scum hunting.

I do indeed normally start games like this! Here is a post from the last game I played in, responding to a similar question:

In post 99, Thesp wrote:These responses had already been curated in a previous game I was in, and is adapted from that answer:

Newbie 1515
Newbie 1498
Micro 311
Mini 1553
Newbie 1042
Newbie 890
Mini 905
Mini 900
Newbie 792

In fact, my distaste for what is commonly referred to as the "Random Voting Stage" of the game has a clear history, as noted here and here and here and here and here (where others also note that RVS isn't useful) and here.

I strongly disagree that the answers are useless (as Stavrogin) has argued. I think they're potentially useful, and as good a starting place as any for a game. I also find it weird that some people get so up in arms about not answering them and insisting that they're a distraction, as it is such a reaction that causes a bigger reaction than giving a simple answer to the question. (That's neither here nor there, I haven't found a strong correlation yet between refusing to answer opening questions and one's alignment.)

Is there any particular reason you don't want to answer the questions? (Related, if they're a distraction, why are you fanning the flames?) Do you think the several preceding posts by other players containing arbitrary votes is more productive than the questions I'm asking and the discussion I'm having?

Is there any particular reason I don't want to answer them? yes, I believe they are pointless and distract away from the task at hand, which is scum hunting and finding scum

Why am I fanning the flames? I'm not, I am genuinely curious about your history of asking these questions and if they have ever helped you find scum based on the answers. It doesn't seem like they do so that leaves me wondering why you would do something that doesn't serve a purpose. Aparently you do this as both town and scum though so i'll just scratch my head on this one.

Do I think rvs is more productive than RQS? Yes, I have helped lynch scum based on bad rvs'ing before, and seen other games where that has happened. RVS wagons in particular are extremely useful.

In post 21, Beck wrote:Is there any particular reason I don't want to answer them? yes, I believe they are pointless and distract away from the task at hand, which is scum hunting and finding scum

*headdesk*
How would you answering the questions be any more distracting than the approach you've taken so far? Would it have been less distracting if you'd just given answers and moved on?
I'm trying to determine your alignment. How exactly is that distracting?

In post 23, Beck wrote:I'm trying to determine your alignment. How exactly is that distracting?

If you not answering the questions is an attempt to determine my alignment, then that's reasonable. (If not answering them is an attempt to avoid "distract[ing] away from the task at hand", as stated earlier, you have miserably failed. )

I'd like to hear answers from others as well.

In post 58, Beck wrote:The problem I have with his line of questioning is he wants everyone to answer, which means he's going to keep us in this stage much longer than it needs to be.

True story: I'm not a big fan of RQS. It always seems to devolve into game theory.
RQS is really good for newbie games. It gives everyone an opportunity to post and tell a little about themselves. During the early stage of the game in a thread full of people you've never played with before, it really makes the game more comfortable for everyone. However, in other games where everyone kind of already knows each other and most people are already comfortable playing the game and asserting themselves without direct interaction, it distracts from the game. RQS answers are generic fluff posts. And the questions are usually loaded.

Thesp is obviously a veteran who plays in a lot of newb games. His RQS is generic and not alignment indicative. If he is scum, starting an RQS is an excellent buddying tool because it leaves the door open to Wifom the shit out of everyone later in the game. And then at endgame people are surprised because "oh, that player seemed so open and honest." which is exactly the place that scum want to be.

So.. Thesp should get some pressure and kick back to his RQS. Unfortunately neither the RQS nor the kickbacks are alignment indicative.
Let me know how you feel about this post.
